title: Collaboration through Github and Rstudio
notes:
Mozilla Festival  //  Open Science track
28 -30 October 2016

Session: Collaboration through Github and Rstudio
Session Time: Saturday, 1PM - 3PM
Session abstract:
This practical session is designed for R users and aims to set beginners in version control up with some basic skills in using github through Rstudio to manage projects and collaborate online.
The first part of the session introduces version control and walks participants through installing all required software, setting up a github account, creating repositories, linking them to Rstudio projects and using them to manage workflows openly.
The rest of the session explores the use of github and Rstudio for collaboration by walking participants through forking and contributing to an existing github repository. Participants will learn how these technologies can be used to manage communications and contributions within a team. At the end of the session, the contributions of all participants will be collated and used to produce an overall team plot.
These very basic skills should form a good foundation for participants to start coordinating collaboration on their own projects and develop their skills further through practice. Thatâ€™s how I learnt!
NB. Participants will get the most out of their session if they bring their own laptops.
